# Aerobatic Elytra
Essentially, a flight simulator in Minecraft.

This mod adds a new elytra item to the game, which, when worn, lets the player
roll in the air like a plane would, while also propelling itself with its
attached rockets (as long as it has fuel).

## Main Features
- **Fly like a plane**! *(it's fun!)*
- Customizable **trails** using fireworks *(one per each of the 4 rockets)*
- Customizable wings with **dyes** and **banners** *(just like [Customizable Elytra](https://www.curseforge.com/minecraft/mc-mods/customizable-elytra))*
- **Boost** by sprinting to go even faster
- **Brake** by crouching to help landing
- **Look around** while flying with a key *(and aim with a bow if you dare)*
- **Bounce** in **slime** blocks
- **Crash** into trees breaking (temporarily) their leaves
- Switch to **vanilla elytra flight** with a key *(if allowed in the server)*
- Other mods may add **new flight modes** *(such as [Aerobatic Elytra Jetpack](https://www.curseforge.com/minecraft/mc-mods/aerobatic-elytra-jetpack))*
- Server-configurable physics and upgrades (speed, underwater flight, ...)

## Datapack Features
This mod exposes some features through custom datapacks.
To make these features easier to use, a few [bundled datapacks](https://github.com/endorh/aerobatic-elytra/wiki/Bundled-Datapacks)
showcasing them are included with the mod, which can be easily installed with
the `/aerobaticelytra datapack install` command.
- Generate Aerobatic Elytras in **End ships** *(or anything you want, it's a loot table)*
- Nerf Aerobatic Elytras with **upgrade systems**
- Add **custom potion effect abilities** to elytras

## Help and Documentation
This mod has a [wiki](https://github.com/endorh/aerobatic-elytra/wiki), which explains all the features
of this mod, and also gives some tips on how to learn to fly.

You may also drop by our [Discord Server](https://discord.gg/gqYVjBq65U) if you have any issues,
questions or feedback of any kind, or if you just want to say hi.

***

If you're a **mod developer** willing to add new flight modes, you can check the
[Aerobatic Elytra Jetpack](https://github.com/endorh/aerobatic-elytra-jetpack)
mod as an example. Most of the extension APIs should be documented in the code as well.

If you're a **modpack developer**, you may take inspiration from the
[bundled datapacks](https://github.com/endorh/aerobatic-elytra/wiki/Bundled-Datapacks), which have their
[source](https://github.com/endorh/aerobatic-elytra/tree/1.19/src/main/resources/data/aerobaticelytra/datapacks)
also available in this repository.
Feel free to use them as templates to create your own packs.
